ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Worked average 8-10 hours at the practicum

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I actually thought that the class sessions to talk about our projects would be a waste of time. I really enjoyed the focus on high level healthcare issues and organizational challenges and how to overcome them. I really enjoyed participating in them and asking questions.
It was nice to apply knowledge from courses in an applicable setting. Dr. Stahl was accommodating to the interests of the students and the practicums that they wanted to do.
This should be open and recommended to ALL first years

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Richard Stahl  The Professor was very responsive and very good with providing comments to our work.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Great instructor who is very willing to help you should any problems arise.

Instructor: Richard Stahl  Dr. Stahl facilitated direction for the practicum experience and connected me with my preceptor, which was very helpful. During meetings, he was also knowledgable and gave thoughtful feedback for every student.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Dr. Stahl really cared about the learning experience for students. I appreciated the type of conversation he fostered.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a great course to get practical experience. It is probably best if you have a specific skill or area that you want to improve or work on. However, it is also best to keep an open arm to different opportunities- you never know what you will learn.
Overall, good experience that allowed me to learn about management and develop professional skills under the guidance of a helpful instructor and preceptor.
